name: New Incentives
headline: Cash transfers that save lives.
description: New Incentives implements cash transfer programs that save lives. We encourage Nigerian mothers to immunize their infants to protect them against deadly diseases.

Cash transfers that save lives
Guided by evidence, we provide cash incentives to increase childhood vaccination rates.
[Our Work](http://www.newincentives.org/</our-work>)
#### Recognized by distinguished charity evaluators and funders
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/632852f96e2c8ab636cf02d7_GiveWell.png)](http://www.newincentives.org/<https:/www.givewell.org/charities/new-incentives>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/63285331e6fa583fc82ea9e2_TLYCS%20Logo.svg)](http://www.newincentives.org/<https:/www.thelifeyoucansave.org/best-charities/new-incentives/>)
[![Founders Pledge
](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/63a0ad90214d45f357d4a68c_Logo.png)](http://www.newincentives.org/<https:/www.founderspledge.com/research/new-incentives>)
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/63936ecf4891cf2b289f63fd_Open_Philanthropy_logo.svg)](http://www.newincentives.org/<https:/www.openphilanthropy.org/grants/new-incentives-nigeria/>)
## Our Reach
4,550,289
Infants served by the program
18,875,296
Cash transfers issued after verifying vaccinations
86.0%
Retention rate through vaccination cycle
2,340,253
Infants Enrolled
7,999,351
Cash Transfers Disbursed
28,583,723
Vaccinations Encouraged
 _*Data updated daily_

![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/6577354a287cb10353adb0d6_Vaccine%20Shot%20in%20Arm%20No%20Hair.png)
4,550,289
Infants Enrolled
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/6567b257005b23c9c56e7d15_Hands%20Passing%201000%20Bill.png)
18,875,296
Cash Transfers Disbursed

Vaccinations Encouraged
 _*Data updated daily_
### Every 19 seconds, someone dies from a disease that could have been prevented by a vaccine. 
[Learn More](http://www.newincentives.org/</archive/cash-incentives-for-vaccination-archive>)
## What We Do
1
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/658038dabefee3520ef832e0_Oral%20Drops_Plain%20Background.png)
We [raise awareness](http://www.newincentives.org/<https:/www.newincentives.org/blog-posts/awareness-activities>) about the benefits of childhood vaccinations. 
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/64ecd9192b00e284dfd6c5f1_Handing%20Document%20and%201000%20Bill.png)
2
We [provide cash incentives](http://www.newincentives.org/<https:/www.newincentives.org/blog-posts/a-day-in-the-life-abubakar-aliyu-field-officer>) at government clinics after children receive vaccinations.
![Icon of vaccine vial](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/6509b51b4cf3c365e3d290fa_Trending%20Upward.png)
3
We [help improve the vaccine supply chain](http://www.newincentives.org/<https:/www.newincentives.org/blog-posts/supporting-government-partners-with-vaccine-supply-efforts>) to ensure enough vaccines are available at clinics.
[Learn More](http://www.newincentives.org/</our-work>)
## What We Do
1
We [raise awareness](http://www.newincentives.org/<https:/www.newincentives.org/blog-posts/awareness-activities>) about the benefits of childhood vaccinations. 
2
We [provide cash incentives](http://www.newincentives.org/<https:/www.newincentives.org/blog-posts/a-day-in-the-life-abubakar-aliyu-field-officer>) at government clinics after children receive vaccinations.
3
We [help improve the vaccine supply chain](http://www.newincentives.org/<#>) to ensure enough vaccines are available at clinics.
[Learn More](http://www.newincentives.org/</our-work>)
## Pilot. Test. Scale.
Our mission is to save lives in a way that does the **most good per dollar.** Evidence has been our guide every step of the way, from inception and design to testing and scaling. Watch our CEO, Svetha Janumpalli, tell the story of how New Incentives started and how it became one of the most cost-effective charities in the world.
[See Evidence](http://www.newincentives.org/</archive/rct-results>)
## Impact
An independent randomized controlled trial found that New Incentives' program led to
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/64ecdfa668b126ab3c7c757a_Vaccine%20Checklist.png)
### 108%
Increase in Full Vaccination Coverage1
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/6605c0db34cc883001108c5d_Clock%20\(Straight\).png)
### 62%
Increase in Timely Measles 1 Vaccination2
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b5ed62aa37b/657735e70795a0cf2c564d4c_Signing%20Documents.png)
### 180%
Increase in Clinics Avoiding Stockouts3
[Learn More](http://www.newincentives.org/</archive/rct-results>)
1Relative to 25% full vaccination coverage rate in the control group. ‍2Relative to 53% of timely vaccination in the control group. ‍3Relative to 10% of clinics reporting no stockouts in the control group.
1 "coverage" refers to children fully vaccinated based on strict definition of having received BCG, three doses of Penta, and Measles 1 vaccines2 ”timely” refers to having received Measles 1 vaccine within one month of recommended age3 likelihood of reporting a vaccine stockout in previous year
## Where We Work
We work in northern Nigeria, a region that has one of the lowest immunization rates in the world and also some of the highest child mortality rates. **An estimated 40 percent of deaths of children under five in Nigeria are from vaccine-preventable diseases.**
[Learn More](http://www.newincentives.org/<https:/www.newincentives.org/our-work#Why-Nigeria>)

##### [A Day in the Life of Hauwa Ibrahim, a Mother from Kwamarawa Village July 18, 2024![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f7c51bf9fac9b11e42aa386/67b10414e9c8428052557340_Webflow%20images%20\(1200%20x%20900%20px\)%20\(2\).png)](http://www.newincentives.org/</blog-posts/a-day-in-the-life-of-hauwa-ibrahim-a-mother-from-kwamarawa-village>)

generated_description:
**New Incentives: Saving Lives Through Cash Transfers**

**Mission:** New Incentives is on a mission that speaks volumes: "Cash transfers that save lives." This nonprofit organization is focused on improving childhood vaccination rates by encouraging Nigerian mothers to immunize their infants against preventable diseases.

**Founded and Location:** Established as part of Y Combinator’s S16 batch, New Incentives is headquartered in San Francisco. With a dedicated team of 51 employees, they are leveraging technology and data to amplify their impact.

**What They Do:** Their approach is straightforward but highly effective: New Incentives provides cash incentives to families after their children receive vaccinations at government clinics. This isn’t just about handing out cash; it’s about creating a reliable system that ensures children get the care they need. They also help raise awareness about vaccination benefits and work to improve local vaccine supply chains.

**Measured Impact:** The results are compelling:
- Over 4.5 million infants have been served by their program.
- Nearly 19 million cash transfers have been issued after vaccination verification.
- A stunning 86% retention rate ensures that families remain engaged throughout the vaccination cycle.

In independent trials, New Incentives demonstrated significant increases in vaccination coverage:
- A 108% increase in full vaccination rates.
- A 62% increase in timely measles vaccinations.
- A 180% improvement in clinics avoiding stockouts of vaccines.

With data updated daily, it’s clear that New Incentives is making strides where it matters most, addressing child mortality rates in Nigeria—where approximately 40% of deaths among children under five are due to vaccine-preventable diseases.

**Why It Matters:** Every 19 seconds, a child dies from a vaccine-preventable disease. New Incentives tackles this grim reality head-on, proving that financial incentives can align public health goals with urgent humanitarian needs.

**Funding and Recognition:** This organization has garnered recognition from esteemed charity evaluators and funders, attaining vital support that allows them to operate effectively while striving to be one of the most cost-effective charities in the world.

If you're interested in learning more or wish to support their mission, visit [New Incentives' website](http://www.newincentives.org) for more information.
